content.question: As a capacitor is being charged, the potential difference <math alttext="delta V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> across the plates and the charge <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> stored on the capacitor are measured. The data are shown in the graph of <math alttext="delta V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> shown above. The work needed to increase the charge on the capacitor from <math alttext="10.0 microcoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>μ</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="15.0 microcoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>μ</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
